commands.name: az network dns record-set txt add-record
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set txt add-record --record-set-name
                                         --resource-group
                                         --value
                                         --zone-name
                                         [--if-none-match]
examples:
az network dns record-set txt add-record -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com \
    -n MyRecordSet -v Owner=WebTeam

commands.name: az network dns record-set txt create
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set txt create --name
                                     --resource-group
                                     --zone-name
                                     [--if-match]
                                     [--if-none-match]
                                     [--metadata]
                                     [--target-resource]
                                     [--tm-profile]
                                     [--ttl]
examples: az network dns record-set txt create -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet --metadata owner=WebTeam

commands.name: az network dns record-set txt delete
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set txt delete [--ids]
                                     [--if-match]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--subscription]
                                     [--yes]
                                     [--zone-name]
examples: az network dns record-set txt delete -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network dns record-set txt list
commands.summary: List TXT record sets in a zone.
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set txt list --resource-group
                                   --zone-name
                                   [--max-items]
                                   [--next-token]
                                   [--recordsetnamesuffix]
                                   [--top]
examples: az network dns record-set txt list -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com

commands.name: az network dns record-set txt remove-record
commands.summary: Remove a TXT record from its record set.
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set txt remove-record --record-set-name
                                            --resource-group
                                            --value
                                            --zone-name
                                            [--keep-empty-record-set]
examples:
az network dns record-set txt remove-record -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com \
    -n MyRecordSet -v Owner=WebTeam

commands.name: az network dns record-set txt show
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set txt show [--ids]
                                   [--name]
                                   [--resource-group]
                                   [--subscription]
                                   [--zone-name]
examples: az network dns record-set txt show -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network dns record-set txt update
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set txt update [--add]
                                     [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--ids]
                                     [--if-match]
                                     [--if-none-match]
                                     [--metadata]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--remove]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--set]
                                     [--subscription]
                                     [--target-resource]
                                     [--tm-profile]
                                     [--zone-name]
examples: az network dns record-set txt update -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet --metadata owner=WebTeam
